title: How the HELL did Tahm Kench make it through another patch without a real nerf?
body: Was Riot too busy nerfing champs that nobody even remembered were in the game?

replies.body: As someone who plays Tahm Kench top a lot, I seriously do not understand how he keeps avoiding getting nerfed. He is so fucking strong it isnt even funny.
Guess why? Because {{champion:98}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:33}} and even {{champion:54}} are all better than him, at least in non- coordinated play...

Better than him at team fighting, sure.

But they are all significantly weaker in lane that Kench is (with the exception of Mundo, who is being nerfed next patch, and is seriously not better than Kench).
And teamfighting = biggest part of soloq. Most of them are also better than him in lane and in mid game fights.. Also dont forget {{champion:57}}

Better than him in lane...

You clearly havent fought a competent Kench.

And you dont get to team fight if you dont survive lane.

But yeah, i totally forget how popular Moakai is right now /sarcasm.
Yeah because being popular totally defines a champions power lol... What does Tahm do pre 6 which is called "laning"? He only wins early against bad players or good match ups.

Post 3, you literally cannot win a trade against him. So no.

A champions popularity actually has a pretty close relationship with his power. Not sure why you think otherwise.
Yeah if you only play Tahm top against champs that he counters or just retards maybe

Ill pick Tahm into anyone. There is no one Tahm should be afraid to lane against top lane right now. No one.

But sure, keep spewing garbage. You havent actually contributed anything except saying 4 champions are better than Kench with literally no support at all. And heres a hint: just because there are better champions does not mean another champion in the same class isnt broken.

And what did you or OP do? Or any other "pls nerf Tahm" thread ever? Nothing other than "spewing garbage" either lol. You dont even have 1 game with Tahm on this account so no one even knows if youre not just lying.
Tahm is a weak champ if you play right against him and let his team engage teamfights and the only reason he is fairly good is because tank itemisazion and masteries are broken in this meta, but ok..
He probably wont get nerfed anymore either.

umm excuse me?
http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-history/NA1/49509024

Just because I havent touched ranked this season doesnt mean I havent played him. He is the only person I even have a mastery 5 right now. Which shows how much more ive played of him than anyone else.


If Tahm was a weak champion, he wouldnt be sitting at a 50% win rate with an 11% pick rate.

Hm well I didnt know normals are apparently hidden when Im "not logged in"... 
Still, I cant remember 1 Tahm really just carrying a game on his own. In fact most Tahms I see just get kited and end up being utterly useless, same with Illaoi.

I dont really care about Tahm, I dont play him and I dont actually have a reason to "defend" him but when there are empty threads literally saying nothing other than "nerf Tahm pls" or totally wrong arguments like "he 1v5s with tank items only" "he oneshots bruiseres with 3k HP" or "he flat out has 2 health bars" that get upvoted hard on a daily basia, thats a bit too much...

All you need to do is look through my match history to see how strong he is.

I am not the best player. But every single game as Tahm Top I have the highest or nearly the highest damage done in the entire game. Even in games I played Support I had nearly as much damage as the top and jungler. 

People tend to exaggerate on the forums. But this is one of the few times where the champion really is a problem and needs something done.

Tahm needs a nerf due to how he can build full tank and deal immense damage, easily killing anyone he wants.  Kiting doesn't solve the issue either, as his Q is on a really low cooldown, all it takes is for him to Q you for a stun and its over.  Also, Popularity does define a champions power.  Zed is one of the most picked mid laners right now, guess what, he just got an insane buff and is very very strong now.  Darius was nearly 100% pick ban in the LCS, why? Because he was insanely strong and beat everyone he went against.  Thresh, single most played support, why? Cause he is the best in his role.  Please... understand WHY THEY GOT POPULAR

> [{quoted}](name=SymbolicFear,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=3UQr3zdh,comment-id=000a0000000100000000000000000000000000000000000000000001,timestamp=2015-11-29T04:41:10.197+0000)
>
> Tahm needs a nerf due to how he can build full tank and deal immense damage, easily killing anyone he wants.  Kiting doesn't solve the issue either, as his Q is on a really low cooldown, all it takes is for him to Q you for a stun and its over.  Also, Popularity does define a champions power.  Zed is one of the most picked mid laners right now, guess what, he just got an insane buff and is very very strong now.  Darius was nearly 100% pick ban in the LCS, why? Because he was insanely strong and beat everyone he went against.  Thresh, single most played support, why? Cause he is the best in his role.  Please... understand WHY THEY GOT POPULAR


uh, youre preaching to the wrong person. I already agree with you...
Tahm is sitting at about 50-51% win rate in Diamond right now, while still maintaining a 12% pick rate.

Tanks like Shen and Rammus are usually played by people who understand how the champion works and have lots of experience with them.

Tahm Kench is a noob magnet, attracting people expecting free games when they play this champion with little prior experience in roles they don't usually play. Thus, a lower average winrate. Look to higher tier play and you'll see something much different.

By being balanced I think 

c:
He has 2 health bars, does more damage than most bruisers, has more utility than most tanks, and can 1v5 with nothing but tank items. Yeah totally balanced.

Because 1 you focused him, 2 you let him damage you, 3 he's a support he has to have utility, 4 How did your marksman even play to let him build pure tank with live LW being literally for tank killing, and 5 It's your team's fault for not being able to stop tahm from dominating instead of focusing whom he doesn't eat and if he does eat offensively whoopy you have squishies who have nothing to save them.

He's basically a champ who you HAVE to punish for his choices which alot of people just don't know how to do.

He's _going_ to be nerfed and everyone knows he needs it.

I dont get you people who wank off to the words "punish him for his choices" like that doesnt apply to every fucking champ in the game, balanced or not.

Guess what? Something can be unbalanced while still having counterplay. I know I blew your mind there didnt I?

Actually I think I realized what happened, what riot needs to do is nerf tahm by removing w working on lane minions, he's working too well in top nerfing w working on minions would hurt his waveclear thus forcing him to use q more to get cs he wants. Jungle/Supp-wise he's fine though but him being top is actually a problem that I was honestly in the dark about since I was basing this off support.

I would never waste my W in lane on a creep unless I seriously needed to push the wave out before basing.

A top Kench who uses W on a creep is one who can no longer win a trade, only an idiot would do it.

Actually I thought about they can:

Remove w working on lane minions
Remove all the AP ratios on tahm's W
Lower the ratio on his Q to 50%

And allow players to QSS his devourer

Cause I was defending Supp tahm actually I forgot top tahm existed since I usually see supp

They may seem like minor nerfs but they can help alot
Who the hell builds AP on Tahm?
He has such crazy bonus hp Ratios that he doesn't need AP.

Right, because minions don't do damage. Because, his Q and auto's don't do retarded damage post 6. And because tahm can't just stack his passive and walk away.

Then again, I only play TK Top with {{item:3751}}, so maybe I'm missing something.

> [{quoted}](name=EcchiOtakuTM,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=3UQr3zdh,comment-id=000100000001,timestamp=2015-11-28T18:30:03.533+0000)
>
> Because 1 you focused him, 2 you let him damage you, 3 he's a support he has to have utility, 4 How did your marksman even play to let him build pure tank with live LW being literally for tank killing, and 5 It's your team's fault for not being able to stop tahm from dominating instead of focusing whom he doesn't eat and if he does eat offensively whoopy you have squishies who have nothing to save them.
> 
> He's basically a champ who you HAVE to punish for his choices which alot of people just don't know how to do.

The fact that you said any of this shows you know almost nothing about Tahm Kench.

1.) No one said he was focused. But ignore a Kench and he will walk through your team and fuck up anyone he wants.


2/3.) A Kench even without items can fuck you up royally thanks to the damage on his W, and base damage on his Q and ult.

4.) LW is significantly weaker right now, you clearly arent playing very much.

5.) ah yes, the infamous "your team didnt shut him down she he should be broken."  That didnt work for Nasus before, it doesnt work for Tahm now.


If Tahm eats offensively, guess what? He still gets to AA and deal damage, AND youre team is fighting a 4v5 until Devour ends. So switching focus means NOTHING, because the enemy gets to switch focus as well (Tahm Devours enemy ADC, switch to enemy mid, and delete them. Where is your argument now?).

Actually I was defending support tahm I forgot about top tahm being a problem however

1. You still ignore him and attempt to kill his squishies thus he will use his devourer defensively giving you free reign on his other allies just make sure not to blow everything for the one squishy

2.  Tahm can do damage yes but you still have to somewhat use 1 CC and attempt to get the rest of his team

4. LW might seem weaker but it's still more useful than just letting him take no damage

5. I didn't say shut him down I meant when tahm tries to go ham try and focus who he can't save or make him attempt to save someone and kill someone else.

but as I said to the other guy some minor nerfs that could help bring top tahm into line are:

Remove w working on lane minions
Remove all the AP ratios on tahm's W
Lower the ratio on his Q to 50%
Allow players to QSS his devourer

They may seem like minor nerfs but they can help alot

The main reason riot can't really nerf top tahm is because support tahm would be drastically affected but those key things would hurt top lane tahm more than supp tahm

1.) If Kench can use his Devour to save his ADC from dying after multiple ults have been burned, guess what? That is a victory. Because his Devour will be back up before your ult, and they can force a fight in the mean time.

2.) Not entirely sure what youre trying to say here. I dont support Kench, but 10 times out of time, in games where I play top Kench, I have the highest damage in the entire game, even when my team loses.

3.) That is irrelevant though. You get LW for any tank, this doesnt suddenly mean more to Kench than it does to Mundo, or to another tank.

The only one of those changes that would effect top kench would be the Ration on his Q. being able to QSS sounds great, until you realize you take the damage from the skill regardless of if you QSS it.

Pretty much no change to fix Kench wont effect both roles. All of his power comes in the form of the slow on his Q, the damage from hp on his ult, and the massive damage on his W. Change any of those will hurt support Kench just as much.
don't forget that except against blitzcrank, he all but renders his lane immune to giving a lead by kills
That's not really true. If you have a jungler gank for you, all they have to do is drop their CC on Kench rather than the ADC. He can't eat himself out of trouble.

its funny cause it's true, i had a match where i was playing TK supp and my asc was vayne the enemy blitzkrank and ashe decided to blow all their cc on me and mot the horribly positioned vayne when their jungle panth ganked, long story short, i came out of it alive with less than 100 hp and vayne got a triple
That's the real issue the old soraka problem if you focus the adc tahm save him if you focus tahm congrats wasting Time on a hard to kill target while the adc run wild

And then he has 2 health bars instead of eating himself out of trouble. Generally the same result really. He gets away.

They need to be insanely pushed for Tahm to not be able to get away with how tanky he is.
{{champion:223}}{{summoner:11}}  + {{item:1409}}{{item:1306}}{{item:3742}}{{item:3083}}{{item:3091}}{{item:3143}} = Water forgets the names of the drowned
Trade {{item:1409}} with {{item:3932}}, and you have INSANE dps.
no{{item:3065}} ? it makes his e passive so much better

Spirit Visage is more along the lines of something I'd use as a bot lane Bond of Stone support tank/peel slave.

In the jungle, Wits End will increase your damage against low-MR champions as well as speed up your jungle-clears a very noticeable amount. You'll also be able to apply three stacks of your passive much quicker when ganking, which is also very nice.

Both are viable; Visage is a wholly-defensive item, however, and often isn't necessary--especially with the aforementioned jungle build posted above.

The only thing he needs is for Riot to admit they fucked up and revert the numerous buffs he received.


Except for the QoL buff that makes his Devour prioritize champions over minions, that one can stay.
tahm kench is funny. he builds tank while doing very high damage.
Illaoi's doing the same thing, but she trades off CC for even more damage.
Illaoi builds AD...
You obviously haven't seen the Illaois that build straight tank and still destroy everyone.
No, I haven't. Kind of sounds like when I play {{champion:98}}.

He at least needs his Q to match the hitbox. I've gotten so many bullshit kills off of that while playing him it isn't even funny.
Also the speed boost after eating an ally doesn't really make sense and is really unnecessary.

I like having a slow, tanky guy who deals lots of damage if he can get to you, but tahm's Q is so easy to hit that it's pretty much a stat check.
I'm looking at his kit and can't really see anything that bad.  He has one big nuke on a large cool down and otherwise he's all on hit damage with no way to really build to maximize it.

Sometimes, you don't look at the damage to see if a champ is strong or not, you look at how well they do their job. Like Alistar was a jungler for a while there and demolishing things despite poor clears, so they reduced his clear speed even more to prevent him from jungling anymore because he was -too- good at it.

Shyv used to be too strong in the top lane, so they nerfed her laning. Lulu was too powerful mid and top, so it got nerfed. Annie was too powerful as a support, so it got nerfed while buffing mid Annie.... They nerf the aspects that make them strong outside of what they should be good at Tahm didn't get any nerfs ever really. They thought he was too poor in his top and jungle roles, so they buffed it without thinking about how powerful his support role was, so his support AND top AND jungle roles were all buffed despite his support role already being really strong with how he could absorb tons of damage, save his carry for SIX seconds while being able to CC a champion for 3s (Morg is the only other champ in the game who can match that kind of CC power in a single ability and total stun length Leona can do is only 2.75s with Q+R, snare gives .5ish seconds based on distance traveled). He's got a 70% slow on his Q and 1.5s stun on his Q, which is on a 6s CD with lowish mana cost... Plus all of his abilities also scale off 4-8% of his bonus health (That's 4-8 per 100 bonus health on every Q, W, and AA. Most health items have 500 health, so that's 20-40 per TANK item) after level 6.  

He's overbearing damage-wise and his tankiness is ungodly. His only weakness is the same as a juggernaut, yet he does the job almost as good while also being capable of providing peel and a 6s Zhonya's for any of his allies on a 10s CD (6s with full CDR, which is common on Tahm). His -only- weakness is the fact he's kitable, but that's where his peeling capabilities come into play. If he's underfed or shut down or what have you, he still has the ability to act as a peeler while if he's ahead, he can peel AND do tons of damage, applying a lot pressure on his opponents who can't really retaliate. 

He's got too much utility for how tanky he is and how much damage he can output.

Fair enough.

This raises a question though, what to do.

Obviously Tahm isn't meant to only be a support so you can't just outright nerf him.  But where do you rebalance him?  Do you aim for stronger early game, or weaken it to let him scale harder towards the late game?

Well, mechanically he'll always be good as a support and his CC is what keeps that, so he'd need his 1v1 toned down. That could be done via his W's base being nerfed by a few % or his E to give less than the full amount of grey health and reduce the decay amount. His team fight would be the same, but his laning presence wouldn't be so oppressive against anyone who isn't ranged with a dash and boots.
